original_title: Sri Lanka shares close up, 1bn turnover
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Tuesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.22 percent, or 23.61 points, at 10,874.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.11 percent, or 3. 48 points, at 3,139.
Turnover crossed 1 billion. The banks sector contributed 215 million, and the food, beverage and tobacco sector contributed 214 million of this.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were Melstacorp Plc (up at 89.30), Aitken Spence Plc (up at 124.50), and Commercial Bank Plc (up at 95.00).
There was a net foreign outflow on 17 million. (Colombo/Dec12/2023)
